Calendar

Use this component to navigate in the calendar, using various combinations of data (month number, day of month, day of year, weekday etc.) and retrieving the full set of such values for each day. You can also use it to compute the differences between two dates in nnumber of days easily.

Basic usage

The calendar displayed in the main part of the screen is initially set to the current date. Changing any of the text fields or clicking a day in the calendar widget will select the new date and recompute all the remaining fields accordingly. Month and year can also be more conveniently changed using the arrow buttons, or swiping over the calendar widget vertically.

Advanced usage

The Days since field displays (or allows the user to enter) the difference in days with respect to the current system date. This anchor can be changed by double clicking the requested date in the calendar widget. It will be shown in red to reflect this property.

It is also possible to mark a subset of days in the calendar by long-clicking them. The marked days will be displayed in yellow colour. This has no other purpose than checking for a possible geometrical pattern leading to the solution of a calendar-based puzzle.

Neither the anchor date nor the set of dates marked this way are kept when the component is exited.

Name days

The app contains a database of Czech and Slovak name days, i.e., names associated with most of the days in a year. This feature is hidden in the English locale by default but can be brought up via Preferences.

If name days are enabled, the name day associated with the selected day of year (or public holiday name in the few cases where there is none) is displayed along the other calendar data. It can also be used to conversely find a day by its name day. If diacritics are present in the name you would like to enter, they can be omitted.

The layout of the component also changes to offer two new tabs, allowing to browse all name days either alphabetically or in the order they appear during the year, respectively.
